start: Nature uses as little as possible of anything.
There is a force in the earth which causes the moon to move.
I used to measure the heavens, now I measure the shadows of Earth.
Although my mind was heaven-bound, the shadow of my body lies here.
Given ships or sails adapted to the breezes of heaven, there will be those who will not shrink from even that vast expanse.
I feel carried away and possessed by an unutterable rapture over the divine spectacle of heavenly harmony
A fresh assault overcame the darkness of my reason...
... finally is moved among the stars
end: We ought not to ask why the human mind troubles to fathom the secrets of the heavens.
The diversity of the phenomena of nature is so great and the treasures hidden in the heavens so rich precisely in order that the human mind shall never be lacking in fresh nourishment.
I much prefer the sharpest criticism of a single intelligent man to the thoughtless approval of the masses.
Truth is the daughter of time, and I feel no shame in being her midwife.
I was almost driven to madness in considering and calculating this matter.
No operation of addition or subtraction gives rise to diversity, but all are equally related to their pair of Terms, or Elements.
the human mind was made to understand.
